Comment.Language: "He Bowed Heaven (Afrek t~ve)" is chanted after the reading of the Praxis and replaces the Hymn of the Resurrection, "All the Choirs (Kata ni,oroc)" and All You Heavenly Hosts:

A procession is done around the church three times venerating the icons of the Lord’s Resurrection and the Lord’s Ascension while chanting the hymn "Christ is Risen (<rictoc a~nect/)," followed by the Greek hymn for the Ascension, "Christ has Ascended (<rictoc a~nalum'ic)":
At the end of the procession the Coptic hymn for the Ascension is chanted:

Text.Language: Pi,~rictoc aftwnf e~bolqen n/eymwout: ouoh afsenaf e~p~swi e~ niv/oui: afhemci caouinam m~Pefiwt qen n/et[oci: aferh~mot nan m~piwnq n~e~neh.
Christ is risen from the dead and has ascended into the heavens, and is seated at the right hand of His Father in the highest, bestowing upon us everlasting life.
المسيح قام من الأموات وصعد إلي السموات، وجلس عن يمين أبيه في الأعالي وانعم لنا بالحياة الأبدية.

Comment.Language: Note that the Sunday after the Ascension is a commemoration of the Resurrection, and so the procession is done only on Sunday and not on each of the days between the Ascension and the Pentecost.
From the Feast of the Ascension of our Lord to the 49th day of the Holy 50 Days:

Text.Language: Pa[oic I/couc Pi,~rictoc: v/e~taftwnf e~bolqen n/eymwout: afsenaf e~p~swi e~niv/oui: afhemci caouinam m~pefiwt.
My Lord Jesus Christ, who rose from the dead, ascended into the heavens, and is seated at the right hand of His Father.
ياربي يسوع المسيح الذي قام من بين الأموات وصعد الي السموات وجلس عن يمين أبيه.
Euws e~bol eujw m~moc: je ,~ouab ouoh ,~ouab ,~ouab P[oic n~nie~w~n <rictoc a~nect/ ek nekrwn.
proclaiming and saying, “Holy, holy, holy, O Lord of the ages, Christ is risen from the dead.”
صارخين قائلين قدوس قدوس قدوس رب الدهور المسيح قام من الاموات.
